rules.text: No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, threats, doxing, trolling, or ageism. No attacks on someone's religion, culture, language, or country of origin. Don't be insulting and argumentative.To be here, you must be nice to people.
Do not spam or create spam accounts
No impersonating people or brands. Satire must be clearly labeled
Do not post Copyrighted materials. We adhere to DMCA take-down notices. See our DMCA policy at the bottom of https://hear-me.social/about. DMCA Registration number:  DMCA-1044123
No ads without permission. Accounts that appear to be created just to promote products and websites will be suspended. In some cases, we may allow the account to remain, but may limit the account.
NO CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE POSTINGS (CSAM)! Be aware that we have Cloudflare automatically scan cached images for CSAM violations. They match mathematical image hashes to a database of known CSAM hashes.

Posting nude photos or controversial pictures and posts without content warnings and appropriate hashtags is not allowed. Also, using inappropriate hashtags to unfairly extend the reach of a post is also not allowed
Targeted misgendering, deadnaming, or promotion of so-called "conversion therapy" is prohibited.
Content created by others must be attributed, and use of AI must be disclosed. Profiles that only post AI-generated content will be suspended
You must be at least 13-years-old to open an account here

records.text: My dear love, I’ve been wanting to post for you all day. I have taken two unplanned naps today. I guess I’m not as “over” this sickness as I thought. I look back so often because it’s there where I find the truth of us. It’s there where our seeds were planted. Did we do this the easy way? No. I don’t love us any less for our faults though. We both tried to tell one another how we felt in our most unique and coded indirect ways. Our timing just wasn’t right then. The real reason you didn’t hear me sooner was a combination of my lack of confident directness and that you weren’t yet ready. We weren’t yet ready. I want to put salve on those wounds. I want to talk to you about each thing in that cave. We will have to walk through that cave together. It’s important that I hear you and know where and why you hurt. I only hope it will feel better when you know you’ve been heard and seen and that I love you, not in spite of it all, but because of who you are. Thank you for telling me that our past is full of sore spots. Let me hold your hand when we walk through them. Today is not the day, but we will walk through them together. Whatever we find in there  we will be okay as long as we keep talking about it, as long as we keep feeling it, even if it feels sad or upsetting. You can tell me the things. Tell me He is awful and how mad He makes you, it’s okay now. Honestly, it was okay back then. I’m not sure I would have known what to do with it, but it would have been okay. Tell me how She made you mad, how she was a barrier, I don’t know what’s in there but you can tell it to me. Show me which gnats are mine, I know I have gnats to eat. Sending you John O’Donahue is my gnat to eat, for sure.  Tell me how you’re mad at yourself. Tell me all the things. I’ve always told you that you can tell me anything. I meant it. Just please, if you want to tell me you’re gay, it’s a little late, I’ll be very disappointed. I wish you were here so I could come wrap my legs around your waist, and pull you against me and wrap you in my arms so you’re just one wrapped up human, my human.

records.text: I know a couple of people who ... do things in the woods. Someone collects dead wood, and puts it in piles for people to use as firewood, which I have issues with, because he's depriving the wood of nutrients, get it? However, it's fairly harmless. Another person cut down one or two green, healthy trees, about 3 ft off the ground, messily, with a saw. No idea what that's about. And then there's me, who cuts down brambles which obstruct the path, and if I see a dead tree which has fallen over, or a damaged branch, I'll go in and clean it up a bit, which is the least objectionable thing in the world. However, a dog-walker just saw me with a saw in my hand in the woods, and will tell the whole village that I'm responsible for everything. Oh well, my conscience is clear.

records.text: My dear love, I’ve been wanting to post for you all day. I have taken two unplanned naps today. I guess I’m not as “over” this sickness as I thought. I look back so often because it’s there where I find the truth of us. It’s there where our seeds were planted. Did we do this the easy way? No. I don’t love us any less for our faults though. We both tried to tell one another how we felt in our most unique and coded indirect ways. Our timing just wasn’t right then. The real reason you didn’t hear me sooner was a combination of my lack of confident directness and that you weren’t yet ready. We weren’t yet ready. I want to put salve on those wounds. I want to talk to you about each thing in that cave. We will have to walk through that cave together. It’s important that I hear you and know where and why you hurt. I only hope it will feel better when you know you’ve been heard and seen and that I love you, not in spite of it all, but because of who you are. Thank you for telling me that our past is full of sore spots. Let me hold your hand when we walk through them. Today is not the day, but we will walk through them together. Whatever we find in there  we will be okay as long as we keep talking about it, as long as we keep feeling it, even if it feels sad or upsetting. You can tell me the things. Tell me He is awful and how mad He makes you, it’s okay now. Honestly, it was okay back then. I’m not sure I would have known what to do with it, but it would have been okay. Tell me how She made you mad, how she was a barrier, I don’t know what’s in there but you can tell it to me. Show me which gnats are mine, I know I have gnats to eat. Sending you John O’Donahue is my gnat to eat, for sure.  Tell me how you’re mad at yourself. Tell me all the things. I’ve always told you that you can tell me anything. I meant it. Just please, if you want to tell me you’re gay, it’s a little late, I’ll be very disappointed. I wish you were here so I could come wrap my legs around your waist, and pull you against me and wrap you in my arms so you’re just one wrapped up human, my human.

However, a dog-walker just saw me with a saw in my hand in the woods, and will tell the whole village that I'm responsible for everything. Oh well, my conscience is clear.

records.text: My dear love, I’ve been wanting to post for you all day. I have taken two unplanned naps today. I guess I’m not as “over” this sickness as I thought. I look back so often because it’s there where I find the truth of us. It’s there where our seeds were planted. Did we do this the easy way? No. I don’t love us any less for our faults though. We both tried to tell one another how we felt in our most unique and coded indirect ways. Our timing just wasn’t right then. The real reason you didn’t hear me sooner was a combination of my lack of confident directness and that you weren’t yet ready. We weren’t yet ready. I want to put salve on those wounds. I want to talk to you about each thing in that cave. We will have to walk through that cave together. It’s important that I hear you and know where and why you hurt. I only hope it will feel better when you know you’ve been heard and seen and that I love you, not in spite of it all, but because of who you are. Thank you for telling me that our past is full of sore spots. Let me hold your hand when we walk through them. Today is not the day, but we will walk through them together. Whatever we find in there  we will be okay as long as we keep talking about it, as long as we keep feeling it, even if it feels sad or upsetting. You can tell me the things. Tell me He is awful and how mad He makes you, it’s okay now. Honestly, it was okay back then. I’m not sure I would have known what to do with it, but it would have been okay. Tell me how She made you mad, how she was a barrier, I don’t know what’s in there but you can tell it to me. Show me which gnats are mine, I know I have gnats to eat. Sending you John O’Donahue is my gnat to eat, for sure.  Tell me how you’re mad at yourself. Tell me all the things. I’ve always told you that you can tell me anything. I meant it. Just please, if you want to tell me you’re gay, it’s a little late, I’ll be very disappointed. I wish you were here so I could come wrap my legs around your waist, and pull you against me and wrap you in my arms so you’re just one wrapped up human, my human.

records.text: My dear love, I’ve been wanting to post for you all day. I have taken two unplanned naps today. I guess I’m not as “over” this sickness as I thought. I look back so often because it’s there where I find the truth of us. It’s there where our seeds were planted. Did we do this the easy way? No. I don’t love us any less for our faults though. We both tried to tell one another how we felt in our most unique and coded indirect ways. Our timing just wasn’t right then. The real reason you didn’t hear me sooner was a combination of my lack of confident directness and that you weren’t yet ready. We weren’t yet ready. I want to put salve on those wounds. I want to talk to you about each thing in that cave. We will have to walk through that cave together. It’s important that I hear you and know where and why you hurt. I only hope it will feel better when you know you’ve been heard and seen and that I love you, not in spite of it all, but because of who you are. Thank you for telling me that our past is full of sore spots. Let me hold your hand when we walk through them. Today is not the day, but we will walk through them together. Whatever we find in there  we will be okay as long as we keep talking about it, as long as we keep feeling it, even if it feels sad or upsetting. You can tell me the things. Tell me He is awful and how mad He makes you, it’s okay now. Honestly, it was okay back then. I’m not sure I would have known what to do with it, but it would have been okay. Tell me how She made you mad, how she was a barrier, I don’t know what’s in there but you can tell it to me. Show me which gnats are mine, I know I have gnats to eat. Sending you John O’Donahue is my gnat to eat, for sure.  Tell me how you’re mad at yourself. Tell me all the things. I’ve always told you that you can tell me anything. I meant it. Just please, if you want to tell me you’re gay, it’s a little late, I’ll be very disappointed. I wish you were here so I could come wrap my legs around your waist, and pull you against me and wrap you in my arms so you’re just one wrapped up human, my human.

records.text: I know a couple of people who ... do things in the woods. Someone collects dead wood, and puts it in piles for people to use as firewood, which I have issues with, because he's depriving the wood of nutrients, get it? However, it's fairly harmless. Another person cut down one or two green, healthy trees, about 3 ft off the ground, messily, with a saw. No idea what that's about. And then there's me, who cuts down brambles which obstruct the path, and if I see a dead tree which has fallen over, or a damaged branch, I'll go in and clean it up a bit, which is the least objectionable thing in the world. However, a dog-walker just saw me with a saw in my hand in the woods, and will tell the whole village that I'm responsible for everything. Oh well, my conscience is clear.
